question_patterns: what documents do i need for admission
entries.answer: For admission documentation support, start at the Dean Office. Carry your academic certificates, mark sheets, identification, and required photographs, plus photocopies.
follow_up: Bring both originals and photocopies.
Ask the Dean Office staff for the latest checklist before submission.

entries.answer: Admission-related support is handled through the Dean Office. Visit there first for process clarification and official verification.
follow_up: Ask for the current intake workflow and deadline sheet.

question_patterns: how do i start first semester
entries.answer: For first-semester onboarding, confirm your department office, class routine, and registration status through your department plus the Dean Office.
follow_up: Check your assigned department first, then verify unresolved items at Dean Office.

entries.answer: Department-specific academic questions should be handled directly in your department office; each department has dedicated rooms for student academic support.
follow_up: Carry your student ID and department details for faster support.

entries.answer: Course registration issues are typically handled through your department and administrative offices; start with your department office and escalate through Dean Office if required.
follow_up: Keep registration receipts and forms with you during clarification.

entries.answer: For exam form, admit card, and exam registration matters, contact the Exam Control Office. They also handle official exam record corrections.
follow_up: Carry your student details and any payment/reference documents.

entries.answer: Transcript and official exam-result record queries are handled by the Exam Control Office.
follow_up: If your issue is admission/identity-related, also check with Dean Office.

entries.answer: For lost or damaged student ID cards, report to the Dean Office for replacement steps and verification.
follow_up: Carry any identity proof and your student details while reporting.

entries.answer: Library timing and membership support are handled at Pulchowk Library. Visit the counter for borrowing rules, renewal policy, and membership details.
follow_up: Carry your student ID for borrowing and membership queries.

entries.answer: Pulchowk Library is the primary verified study space for quiet reading and academic preparation.
follow_up: Use reading areas for focused study and ask library staff for section guidance.

entries.answer: Boys hostels are in Blocks A, B, and C; Girls Hostel and MSC Hostel are separate dedicated residential facilities inside campus.
follow_up: For allocation procedures, confirm with the relevant hostel administration office.

entries.answer: For hostel allocation and room allotment process details, begin at the Dean Office and then follow hostel administration instructions.
follow_up: Keep your admission details ready before applying for allotment.

entries.answer: Campus Mess and Campus Canteen are the main food points, and Niraula Stores is useful for quick snacks and essentials.
follow_up: Hostel residents should confirm mess timing directly with mess management.

entries.answer: Om Stationery Store is the verified on-campus point for printing, photocopying, binding, and stationery purchases.
follow_up: Visit with your soft copy ready to reduce waiting time.

entries.answer: Two verified ATM points are available: Nabil Bank ATM and Siddhartha Bank ATM.
follow_up: If one ATM is down, use the other nearby point.

entries.answer: You can use the Water Vending Machine and nearby public water tap points for drinking water access.
follow_up: Carry your own bottle for regular refill use.

entries.answer: Public sanitation facilities are available at designated toilet blocks and changing-room toilet locations around campus.
follow_up: Use the nearest marked sanitation point from map directions.

entries.answer: FSU Clinic is the verified first-stop location for basic medical help and first-aid support on campus.
follow_up: For emergency-level conditions, seek immediate external emergency services.

entries.answer: Student complaints and representation matters are handled by the FSU Office, with escalation support through campus administration when needed.
follow_up: Document your issue clearly before submitting a complaint.

entries.answer: Multiple parking zones are available inside campus for two-wheelers and four-wheelers, depending on your destination block.
follow_up: Use the nearest parking area to your destination block.

entries.answer: Pulchowk has Main Entrance plus additional First and Second Entrance points for easier access to different campus zones.
follow_up: Choose the entrance nearest to your target building.

entries.answer: If you are near Pulchowk Library or the Electrical department zone, use the nearest mapped restroom points shown on the campus map.
follow_up: Ask nearby staff if a floor-specific restroom is temporarily unavailable.

entries.answer: Use the app's Notices section for aggregated updates, and verify critical exam-related updates against official campus and IOE exam notice channels.
follow_up: For urgent academic consequences, confirm directly with Exam Control Office.

question_patterns: which notices are important for first year
what notice category should i follow
entries.answer: New students should prioritize admission, registration, exam-form, and department routine notices, then follow hostel and student-service updates.
follow_up: If a notice is unclear, verify it at the responsible office the same day.

question_patterns: where can i join technical clubs
entries.answer: You can explore technical and creative clubs such as Robotics Club, Electrical Club, Music Club, LOCUS Office, and SEDS Pulchowk.
follow_up: Visit club offices and ask for current recruitment or orientation sessions.

entries.answer: Campus sports facilities include football and cricket grounds, basketball and volleyball courts, badminton courts, gym hall, and outdoor calisthenics area.
follow_up: Check event notices for sports timetable or tournament access.

entries.answer: Helpful campus landmarks include Helicopter Parking, PI Chautari, Saraswati Mandir, Suspension Bridge, and The Helm of IOE Pulchowk.
follow_up: Use these landmarks for giving or following walking directions.

entries.answer: For urgent exam or result issues, contact the Exam Control Office immediately and keep your supporting documents ready.
follow_up: If unresolved, escalate through Dean Office with written details.

question_patterns: who to contact urgently in campus
entries.answer: For urgent administrative issues, Dean Office is the primary escalation point for institutional coordination.
follow_up: Bring any supporting references, forms, or prior communication details.

entries.answer: For immediate on-campus health support, go to FSU Clinic first and contact emergency medical services if the condition is serious.
follow_up: Do not delay emergency response for severe symptoms.

entries.answer: Major practical facilities include Hydro Lab, Hydraulic Lab, High Voltage Lab, Machine Workshop, and Central Material Testing Laboratory.
follow_up: Confirm your specific lab room and schedule from your department.

entries.answer: Key academic support units include Center for Energy Studies, Continuing Education Center, and CIDS for specialized programs and coordination.
follow_up: Visit the respective office for current program availability.

entries.answer: Student support and representation spaces include FSU Office, NTBNS, Pulchowk Girls support point, and ASA Office.
follow_up: Use these offices for student coordination, welfare, and peer support.

question_patterns: where are block d e f g
entries.answer: Core academic blocks are D, E, F, and G blocks, with separate departmental and lab zones across the campus.
follow_up: Use map search with your class block name before heading to class.

entries.answer: Niraula Stores is a convenient point for quick essentials and snacks, especially useful near hostel and student movement areas.
follow_up: For printing or stationery, use Om Stationery Store.

question_patterns: how to get directions in app
entries.answer: Ask in natural language, for example: 'Show me directions from Pulchowk Library to Campus Mess' or 'Where is Exam Control Office?'.
follow_up: Use exact building names for the fastest and most accurate routing.

entries.answer: Exact deadlines can change quickly. Please verify the latest official notice and confirm with the responsible office before acting.
follow_up: Always cross-check same-day deadline details from official notices.

general.message: I do not have a verified answer for that yet. Please verify through the Dean Office or official notices before taking action.
follow_up: You can ask me route questions like 'from Pulchowk Library to Exam Control Office'.

deadline_query.message: I cannot confirm that deadline from verified data right now. Please verify from official notices and the responsible office.
follow_up: Use official notice channels for same-day deadline decisions.

escalation.message: For urgent campus issues, contact the relevant office immediately. If unsure, start at Dean Office for official escalation guidance.
follow_up: For urgent medical cases, go to FSU Clinic and seek emergency services as needed.
